snippet: A rule stated that if retirees withdrew 4.5 percent of their savings every year — adjusted for inflation — their nest eggs would last 30 years. Not anymore.
abstract: Many financial advisers are rejecting rule that if retirees withdraw 4.5 percent of their savings every year, adjusted for inflation, their nest egg should last 30 years; retiree portfolios now earn about 3.5 percent to 4 percent, instead of 8 percent that rule was calculated with.
lead_paragraph: A rule stated that if retirees withdrew 4.5 percent of their savings every year — adjusted for inflation — their nest eggs would last 30 years. Not anymore.

headline.seo: The 4% Rule for Retirement Withdrawals May Be Outdated
headline.main: 4% Rule for Retirement Withdrawals Is Golden No More
headline.print_headline: 4% Rule for Retirement Withdrawals Is Golden No More
